title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5319.49 - Mystery awards
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5319.49 - Mystery awards

State Regulations

It is acceptable for a game to offer a mystery award, which is an award that is not tied to any specific symbol combination, if such
game indicates the maximum amount the player potentially could win. If the
minimum amount that potentially could be won is not displayed, such amount will
be assumed to be zero. In addition, both a minimum and maximum amount shall be
displayed for any mystery award if the method to receive such award involves
strategy or skill, including methods whereby the value of the pay table is used
in order to make decisions that could increase the return to the player (e.g., video poker). Notes

New

York State Register November 16, 2016/Volume XXXVIII, Issue 46, eff. 11/16/2016

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
